description: Erection of a single storey granny annexe for ancillary use to the main dwelling house.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission. Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:LDP/518/03/ALDP/518/05/ALDP/518/01/ALDP/518/02/ALDP/518/04/ALDP/518/06/AReason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Unless otherwise specified in the application the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted along with work of making good shall be carried out in materials to match those of the existing building.Reason: To ensure that the appearance of the development respects the appearance, existing materials and built and natural features of the surrounding area.

The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied at any time other than for purposes ancillary to the residential use of the existing dwelling and shall not be used as an independent dwelling at any time.Reason: To ensure that the development complies with adopted standards, does not impact on neighbouring amenity and is in character with the existing form of development in the locality in accordance with relevant adopted planning policies of the Enfield Local Plan.
